petar_chervenski wrote:
> 
> 1. Feedback can be achieved as adding more inputs that represent the
> ACTUAL joint angles at the moment.

Don't forget joint rotation too.  Particularly at the hips, shoulders, 
and ankles.  I'm not sure if you're simulation is doing this at these 
joints right now, but I think it's pretty important.

As an example of the rotational motions I'm talking about:

* hips:  stand, feet together.  squat until knees are bent 90 degrees. 
move knees apart and together
* ankles:  sit, legs extended above ground, feet together.  move toes 
apart and together with heels touching.
* shoulders:  lock elbow at 90 degrees.  place elbow on table.  move 
hand up and down while keeping elbow in one place.  like arm wrestling.

--Steve
